data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Heavy cleanup of the draw_square tutorial. (#152)

* Heavy cleanup of the draw_square tutorial.

In particular:
1. Make it conform to the current ROS 2 style.
2. Add in copyright information.
3. Refactor the entire code into a class, which tidies it
   up quite a bit and removes a bunch of globals.
4. Make sure to wait for the reset to complete before trying
   to move the turtle.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove the range constraints from the holonomic parameter. (#150)

It is a boolean, so it should not have an integer range.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Update turtlesim to C++17. (#146)

The main reason to do this is so that we can compile turtlesim
with the clang static analyzer.  As of clang++-14 (what is in
Ubuntu 22.04), the default still seems to be C++14, so we need
to specify C++17 so that new things in the rclcpp headers work
properly.

Further, due to reasons I don't fully understand, I needed to
set CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED in order for clang to really use
that version.  So set this as well.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Daisuke Sato
data.message:
Add parameter to enable holonomic motion (#131)

* Add holonomic motion option

* Rely on the node for parameter value storage

This has the advantage of maintaining ABI compatibility and let's users change the value during runtime.

Also turn holonomic feature off by default to maintain the current behavior.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Seulbae Kim
data.message:
Use `double` when handling `qreal orient_` (#114)

When the value of `orient_` crosses the boundary of `float`, e.g., when
`cmd_vel.angular.z = -4.0e+214`, `normalizeAngle` returns `nan`.
As a result, `x`, `y`, and `theta` all become `nan`, and turtle disappears
from the frame.

As `qreal` corresponds to `double`, `normalizeAngle` should be taking param
`angle` as `double`, and return `double` accordingly.

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Print out the correct node name on startup. (#122)

Previously, this code was calling 'get_node_names()' and just
choosing the first out of the list.  But that could be literally
anything if there are other nodes running in the network.
Instead, call 'get_fully_qualified_name()' instead to get the
name of this node.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Heavily cleanup teleop_turtle_key. (#121)

* Heavily cleanup teleop_turtle_key.

1. Rearrange code so it is in a more logical order.
2. Switch from spin_some to spin, which should be lighter on
   CPU time.
3. Get rid of complicated actions in a signal handler.
4. Set the timeout on the keyboard reader so it will check status
   between loops.
5. Fixup the Windows keyboard handling to not use 100% CPU and
   to properly respond to Ctrl-C.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Add step value to turtlesim color parameters (#91)

The step value defaults to 0, which renders stepwise changes to the
parameters in `rqt_reconfigure`, such as keyboard or mouse scroll
controls, impossible.

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Add RotateAbsolute action to turtlesim (#62)

* [turtlesim] Add action interface for rotating to absolute angle

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Implement RotateAbsolute action

Only one action is executed at a time. Any new actions override existing ones.
If a velocity command is received while executing the action, then the goal is aborted.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Support triggering rotation action with keyboard teleop

Use the keys g/b/v/c/d/e/r/t to rotate the turtle to absolute orientations and 'f' to cancel a rotation.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Catch exceptions when attempting to cancel goal

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Add back input.shutdown()

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Add back rclcpp::shutdown

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Define TWO_PI from PI in header

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* match style
